results.title: A Citizen of Singapore
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Malayan Film Unit and Brian Salt
results.brief_description: Through the story of a seven-year-old, Hung Swee Kiat, the film outlines the scope and progress of Singapore’s Ten Year Development Scheme to provide free education for all children, regardless of race and creed. The film closes with official ceremonies at a youth rally which concluded Education Week, during which exhibitions and displays brought the Scheme to the notice of the public.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gaumont-British Instructional, Malayan Film Unit and Brian Salt

results.title: A Circus story
results.creator_credit: Major Carpenter, Marshall Majors Productions, Barr Films and Marshall Riggan
results.brief_description: An account of the arrival, setting up and the performance of a circus in the small town of Berrybille, Arkansas, USA. Discusses the status, role and function of the circus today and suggests reasons for the romantic appeal of the circus. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: A Circle of love
results.creator_credit: Isaac Kleinerman, Peter Poor, CBS News and West Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
A group of college students get together in a “circle of love”, ie an “encounter group” to improve interpersonal relationships. Comprises highlights from several sessions in which six students, who have never met before, react to taped instructions from a behavioural research institute. Participants learn to express their real feelings about themselves and their fellow students, and learn to overcome anxieties and shyness in the presence of others. Reporter: Walter Cronkite
results.creator_credit_for_label: Isaac Kleinerman, Peter Poor, CBS News and West Coast Productions

results.title: A Christmas dream [English version]
results.creator_credit: United World Films and Karel Zeman
results.brief_description: A fantasy in which a little girl’s toys come to life in a dream - the toys being played by Puppets. (The film is noteworthy for the excellence of the puppet animation in the original material - for American distribution, introductory and concluding sequences have been added to the film by Castle Films, USA.). This film was directed by Karel Zeman at the Gottwaldov Puppet Studios, Czechoslovakia.

results.title: A Children's welcome
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: This film was made in honour of the Queen Mother’s visit to Melbourne on March 3rd, 1958. A performance for the Queen Mother, by the school children of Victoria, was staged at the Melbourne Cricket Ground with items arranged by the Physical Education Department and accompanied by the RAAF Band. Family and friends were gathered in the stands of the MCG to watch and cheer on the children. At the end of the performance, the Queen Mother toured in an open car around the MCG.

results.title: A Children's Fable
results.brief_description: Three children, inspired by a program they saw on television, dress up in costumes and set out in search for the Holy Grail. Begun as a game, their quest becomes a terrifying adventure from which emerges a parable of racial confrontation and moral rebirth.
results.description: Three children, inspired by a program they saw on television, dress up in costumes and set out in search for the Holy Grail. Begun as a game, their quest becomes a terrifying adventure from which emerges a parable of racial confrontation and moral rebirth.

results.title: A Child is a child (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: A L Levitt, Dubnoff Center, AIMS Instructional Media and Molly Gorelick
results.brief_description: Shows children with handicaps integrated with non-handicapped children in the pre-school laboratory at California State University, Northridge. It shows that the trend towards special education for children with handicaps has gone so far that many educators tend to lose sight of the fundamental fact that a child is a child.
results.creator_credit_for_label: A L Levitt, Dubnoff Center, AIMS Instructional Media and Molly Gorelick

results.title: A child grows: the first year
results.brief_description: This program focuses on the physiological and psychological landmarks of the first year of life: noting that the order, not the timing is predictable. Using footage of infants to illustrate each point of maturation, areas covered include; motor development; muscle control and strength - from birth; reflex actions - smiling, rolling over, sitting, crawling, walking; hand-eye co-ordination; exploration of world and link to feeding and digestion; sensory development; language and speech development; developmental norms; attachment, separation and anxiety; development of thinking, planning, goal directed actions and; symbolic representations. Informative and useful to both students and parents of newborns.

results.title: A Child's voice
results.creator_credit: Roland Hill, B.A.C. Films Ltd (Ireland) and Kieran Hickey
results.brief_description: A tale of suspense. Three nights a week, Ainsley Rupert Macreadie writes and broadcasts chilling and intriguing tales of horror to rapt audiences. But his latest cruel narrative becomes a reality when the character of the boy involved refuses to obey the writer’s commands, and Macreadie discovers that he is the victim of the kind of terror which until now he has reserved for others. Starring T.P. McKenna as Ainsley Rupert Macreadie, June Tobin as the child. Written by David Thomson and narrated by Valentine Dyall. (Awards: First Prize Short Fiction Category - Chicago International Film Festival, 1978; Festival Choice - London Film Festival, 1978) Suitable for middle and upper secondary level.

results.title: A Child's visit to the dentist
results.brief_description: Designed to allay children’s fear of the dentist and all that dentists represent, by following a five-fear-old on her first visit to the dentist. Outlines the function of various people working in the surgery, as well as explaining the purposes of X-ray machines, drills, scrapers, etc.
